having a magnetic permeability slightly greater than unity and varying to only a small extent with the magnetising force; magnetic in the ordinary sense- said of bodies that when freely suspended between the poles of magnet place themselves parallel to the lines of force, as opp. to diamagnetic; paramagnetic.
the quality of being paramagnetic.
the quality of being of condition of relating to a magnetisable substance that has small but positive susceptibility which varies little with magnetising force; paramagnetism.

the practice or policy of adapting one's actions, judgments, application of rules relating to rites, etc. to circumstances, as in politics, in order to further one's immediate interests, without regard for basic principles or eventual consequences; opportunism.

secured; related; connected.
tied with or together; fastened.
(psych.) secured by training.
to fasten, attach or bind together or to something else, as with string, cord or rope made secure by knotting, etc.
to connect, join or bind in any way.
to annex; to append (as an additional information to a book, statement etc.) 3) to go after closely; to follow.
to support or advocate the ideas, opinions, etc. of.
to continue, carry on something further done so far by another.
(Psych.) to condition i.e. a) to develop a conditioned reflex or behaviour pattern in (a person or animal); b) to cause to become accustomed (to something).
attached with; fastened to.
connected, joined with.
occurring in pairs; having two pairs of leaflets, as some pinnate leaves; conjugate; bijugate.
(Jain.) any of the three seers (Gautama, Sudharmasvāmi & Jambūsvāmi) who came later to Vardhamāna Tīrthankara.
= ಅನುಬದ್ಧಕೇವಲ.
= ಅನುಬದ್ಧಕೇವಲ.
the state or quality of being bound together.

(Biol.) conjugation in the reproductive processes of simple forms, a) the fusion of a male and female gamete, as in certain algae b) a temporary union of two one-celled organisms with an exchange of nuclear material, as in certain protozoans.
= ಅನುಬದ್ಧತೆ - 2.
a supporting contingent of soldiers; 2 the act of supporting; support.
the visual impression of something produced by reflection from a mirror, refraction through a lens, etc. 2) a person or thing very much like another; a copy; a counterpart; likeness.
(Psych.) an image or sensation that remains or returns after the external stimulus has been withdrawn; after-image.
to give back an image of; mirror or reproduce; to reflect.
to become very much like another.
the knowledge based on the previous experience or knowledge.
the miṇḍs perception of itself as a conscious agent; appreciation.
(psych.) act of giving instructions to the mind.
an after thought, i.e. a) an idea, explanation, part, etc. coming or added later; b) a thought coming too late, after the occasion for which it was apt.
an agent to bring forth effectively the scent from a perfumery substance.
experience - a) the effect on a person of anything or everything that has happened to that person; individual reaction to events, feelings, etc.; b) anything observed or lived through.
knowledge received through the sense organs (as dif. from the one got from thinking, meditation, cogitation etc.).
the act or process of directly perceiving events or reality.
the act or state of enjoying an object, property etc. having them in possession; enjoyment.
the mystical experience.
one of the seven kinds of religious devotion .
knowable only by means of experience.
the condition or fact of being knowable only by means of experience.
emanating from or caused by, experience.
the quality or fact of emanating from or being caused by, experience.
= ಅನುಭವಣೆ.
the responsibilities of an administrator or a government.
the experience got from the sense organs.
the way in which something is arranged; arrangement.
a man enjoying the ownership or benefits; an occupant or a possessor.
a man having or getting the experience.
the condition of or legal entitlement to, enjoying the benefits.
an official document conferring on a person the ownership of a property (esp. of agricultural land).
a higher stage of devotion to the God, in which the devotee experiences the feeling of the Goḍs presence or proximity.
